description:
Baba Lamunade is followed home by two strange peddler girls who give him a CD-rom game. After he beats "The Legend of Lamuness", the girls come out of his computer and bring him to DokiDoki Space. He is the third descendant of the hero Lamuness who must stop Don Genosai from resurrecting the great evil Abraham. Accompanied by PQ, his advisor robot, and Parfait and Cacao, he must pilot the Kaizer Fire mecha. However, he needs another pilot, and Da Cider is chosen as the second pilot.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Isekai

node.description: A freelance animator and designer, started working for Gainax in Gunbuster and Fushigi no Umi no Nadia. He left Gainax to join Gonzo, where he developed the character designs for Vandread.
A freelance animator and designer, started working for Gainax in Gunbuster and Fushigi no Umi no Nadia. He left Gainax to join Gonzo, where he developed the character designs for Vandread.
A freelance animator and designer, started working for Gainax in Gunbuster and Fushigi no Umi no Nadia. He left Gainax to join Gonzo, where he developed the character designs for Vandread.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/931752627359977472)

Currently mainly active at [Trigger](https://anilist.co/studio/803/).

Yoshigaki joined [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/) after graduating from Yoyogi Animation School. There he immediately got along with fellow animator [Hiroyuki Imaishi](https://anilist.co/staff/97349/), who joined the studio at the same time. Imaishi says that Yoshigaki is the "ideal animator."

Oishi worked at Studio Junio at the beginning of his career, and soon after joined [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/). There he debuted as a key animator on [Mobile Suit Victory Gundam](https://anilist.co/anime/89/) in 1993. [Hideyuki Morioka](https://anilist.co/staff/101526/) and [You Yoshinari](https://anilist.co/staff/102998/) were among his co-workers at the studio. In 1994, Oishi got involved on [Yu Yu Hakusho](https://anilist.co/anime/392/) as a key animator and during its production he met [Akiyuki Shinbou](https://anilist.co/staff/100089/), a prolific episode director on the series and a to be long-time colleague and friend of his. Oishi continued working as a freelance animator through the '90s.

In 2001, he made his directorial debut with the 46th episode of [Cyborg 009: The Cyborg Soldier](https://anilist.co/anime/1678/). Soon after this he started getting involved in studio [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/)'s works with aforementioned Shinbou. In 2009, Shinbou and him directed [Bakemonogatari](https://anilist.co/anime/5081/) together, with Oishi serving as the chief director. In 2016, he directed the movie trilogy [Kizumonogatari](https://anilist.co/anime/9260/), which is considered to be his magnum-opus. Oishi usually draws his works' storyboards himself, and is known for taking a long time finishing them. Kizumonogatari's storyboards took him several years to complete.

[Naoyuki Tatsuwa](https://anilist.co/staff/103584/), who has also been involved in many of Shaft's projects, called him the "[Togashi](https://anilist.co/staff/96893/) of Shaft."
A freelance animator and designer, started working for Gainax in Gunbuster and Fushigi no Umi no Nadia. He left Gainax to join Gonzo, where he developed the character designs for Vandread.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/823822162876170240)

Well-known works include the Sakura Wars franchise. Married to mangaka [Miyuki Kitagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/98586/).
Hideyuki Tanaka is a sound director for anime and the founder and representative director of sound production studio Audio Tanaka.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nishiki_hiroshi)

He is unilaterally liked by [Kunihiko Ikuhara](https://anilist.co/staff/100082/Kunihiko-Ikuhara). His work on [Revolutionary Girl Utena](https://anilist.co/anime/440/Revolutionary-Girl-Utena/) storyboards were outright claimed to be the "closest to his own style" , in principle, by Ikuhara himself.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nishiki_hiroshi)

He is unilaterally liked by [Kunihiko Ikuhara](https://anilist.co/staff/100082/Kunihiko-Ikuhara). His work on [Revolutionary Girl Utena](https://anilist.co/anime/440/Revolutionary-Girl-Utena/) storyboards were outright claimed to be the "closest to his own style" , in principle, by Ikuhara himself.
